answers.answer: Looks like a mild stroke symptom.I've a diabetes type2 for 10 years and I've experiance a numbness leg due to my blood sugar not maintaing well also.The link below may give you basic info about stroke/TIAStroke - http://www.stroke.org.ukTake my advice please:The best thing is refer to your family doctor immediately.Early diagnost can save life.

question: I'm a 23yr old lady in good health.i take good care of myself in that i eat a healthy diet and exercise atleast 4 times a week. i have recently started experiencing strange muscle ar nerve pulls in the head, the bottom,left side of the back of my head. a few days ago i started having a funny sensation in the left leg and eventully i lost some sense in the region below the knee to the foot. i have constant headaches lately and wonder if these could be symptoms of a stroke or some heart disease?
title: Nerve blows and numb leg
